channel.title: Adding a level cap for location?
channel.description: This sounds a bit funky, but I'm working on a tutorial island. And I want it to have the legit level 3 max. I created a boolean for the coords around the island (essentially I made a huge square around it :P). Now I need to write the method to check your position/level/xp gain. Anyone got a good idea how to start writing this?

item.title: Adding a level cap for location?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:8, topic:471117”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=588655.msg4173647#msg4173647 date=1354686654]

It just doesn’t initialize I believe.

Are you calling capForTut() anywhere?

I initialized it somewhere, can’t remember where exactly, but it was supposed to be called like a normal void.
[/quote]

You have to call it wherever object action handling occurs.[/quote]
Oh, I forgot to mention. I didn’t put it in my object handler because I saw no area for it to fit in. I moved to to my player class.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a level cap for location?

item.title: Adding a level cap for location?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:3, topic:471117”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=588655.msg4173528#msg4173528 date=1354674761]

public boolean isAtTutorialIsland() {
    return location.isWithinBounds(blah, blah);
}

Then in your object event handler

if (player.isAtTutorialIsland()) {
    if (!player.getSkillLevel(skillId) < 3) {
        doStuff();
    }
    else {
        // You can remove this part if you want. This code will be
        // executed if their skill level is >= 3
        player.sendMessage("There's nothing more you can learn here.");
    }
}

[/quote]
I kind of took what you gave me and threw some crap code into it, moved things around and here’s my result:

	public void capForTut(){
			if (isInTut()) {
			 for (int i = 0; i < 21; i++)
			if (getLevelForXP(i) < 3) {

				// You can remove this part if you want. This code will be
				// executed if their skill level is >= 3
				sendMessage("There's nothing more you can learn here.");
			}else
			return;
		}	
	}

I’m testing it now, but any comments/fixes?
Edit: it doesn’t work :([/quote]

What exactly isn’t working?

Read full topic
item.source: Adding a level cap for location?

item.title: Adding a level cap for location?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:2, topic:471117”] public boolean isAtTutorialIsland() { return location.isWithinBounds(blah, blah); }

Then in your object event handler

if (player.isAtTutorialIsland()) { if (!player.getSkillLevel(skillId) < 3) { doStuff(); } else { // You can remove this part if you want. This code will be // executed if their skill level is >= 3 player.sendMessage("There's nothing more you can learn here."); } } [/quote]
I kind of took what you gave me and threw some crap code into it, moved things around and here’s my result:

	public void capForTut(){
			if (isInTut()) {
			 for (int i = 0; i < 21; i++)
			if (getLevelForXP(i) < 3) {

				// You can remove this part if you want. This code will be
				// executed if their skill level is >= 3
				sendMessage("There's nothing more you can learn here.");
			}else
			return;
		}	
	}

I’m testing it now, but any comments/fixes?
Edit: it doesn’t work

item.title: Adding a level cap for location?
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

public boolean isAtTutorialIsland() {
    return location.isWithinBounds(blah, blah);
}

Then in your object event handler

if (player.isAtTutorialIsland()) {
    if (!player.getSkillLevel(skillId) < 3) {
        doStuff();
    }
    else {
        // You can remove this part if you want. This code will be
        // executed if their skill level is >= 3
        player.sendMessage("There's nothing more you can learn here.");
    }
}
